moves.1... d5: I take advantage of the center
moves.8. bxc3 O-O: castle kingside still with a pawn lead
moves.9... b5: ?? I have no clue why I played this I was always planning to play Be6. I think I thought the pawn was defended and I could get his queen away
moves.10. Qxb5: He takes of course and due to my blunder were tied, if anything hes in the lead due to my double pawns and an isolated one
moves.10... Qd5: defend the pawn and offer a trade
moves.11. Qxd5 Nxd5: puts my knight in a more dangerous position
moves.14. Bg2: he continues to attack my knight. I cannot move either knight because I will be down a rook or knight. He is probably winning because he has full mobility to his pieces.
moves.16. d3: ?? loses a knight this is probably where he loses the game but he still has a chance with his bishop in a great position
moves.16... cxd3: I take no need to lose a pawn I can always play g4
moves.17. exd3 g4: winning a knight and taking my first advantage since the opening
moves.18. Ng5: I probably would have played Kf4 because then he'll also win the c7 pawn
moves.19... Rb8: Best move by far. If I don't play this then Bxe7 Nxf7 Bxa8. If I dont play this I at least lose a knight and probably more.
moves.21. Rxb1 Kh7: trying to chase his bishop away
moves.23. Bxh3: Yes I can finally move my knight but not yet because e7 would be unprotected
moves.23... Nd5: so I decide to move it threatening c3
moves.26... Nf6: so I move away threatening his pawn
moves.27. Rc5: I thought I had lost a pawn but
moves.28... e4: ! I trade pawns. If he takes e4 then ai take with Kxe4 forking his rook and bishop. So he must play Bxd4.
moves.29. Bxf4 exd3: I trade pawns. It looks like I actually lost two pawns but if Bxc7 then d2 and he cant stop me from queening.
moves.30. Bg2: Here I thought I was done because he would take my knight or at least win the pawn but...
moves.30... Rxg4: ! Bam pinning his bishop and he resigns. Thank you for watching please comment any of my mistakes or any observations.
